Substeps.Procedure: Used unicode right-to-left override (RTLO) character to obfuscate file name rcs.3aka3.doc (originally cod.3aka.scr)

A General detection was generated for "Suspicious File Detected rcs.3aka3.doc" due to machine learning identifying the payload as a PE32 executable and analyzing it.

Adversaries.Alerting_Strategy: Events that are deemed to be related to a compromise are assigned appropriate severity values (Low, Medium, High). These compromise-related events are also enriched with contextual information, such as a short description or potential mappings to related ATT&CK Tactics and Techniques. Events potentially associated with compromise are aggregated into specific views and tagged with corresponding IOCs related to each event.
Adversaries.Correlation_Strategy: Events are aggregated into a central queue, where the data for each can be explored. Data within each event captures relevant evidence, including correlation between surrounding system events such as process lineage or interactions between processes and files. There are additional dashboards that provide a wider perspective on events across multiple hosts. There is also the ability to correlate events across more in-depth data captured from a full system dump.
